contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) this is a polite way to say the young woman was sleeping with the male figures. AT: "you slept with them" or 2) this is a metaphor in which Yahweh speaks of her worshiping the figures as if she were sleeping with them. AT: "you worshiped them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: you did with them as a prostitute would do

contextId.information: This is a euphemism that means to kill. AT: "kill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
This is a euphemism that means to kill. AT: "kill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

"every knee will be as weak as water" (UDB). This is a euphemism for people being so afraid that they lose their bladder control and urinate on themselves. AT: "every leg will be wet with urine" or "everyone will lose control of their urine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: every knee will flow like water

contextId.information: This compares the way men slept with her to the way men sleep with a prostitute. AT: "They slept with her in the same way that men sleep with a prostitute" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
contextId.quote: They went in to her and slept with her as men go in to be with a prostitute
